page.title: 09THE SHOP AT WOODFALLS CROSS
page.content: THIS IS THE NEAREST SHOP TO THE VILLAGE OF HALE. IT SELLS FOOD, CIGARETTES, WINES AND SPIRITS. APPROXIMATELY 1200 CUSTOMERS GO TO THE SHOP EACH WEEK AND 90% OF THEM ARE LOCAL. ALSO 90% OF THEM ARE WOMEN. ON AVERAGE A CUSTOMER SPENDS Â£3 ON EACH VIST AND THE WEEKLY TAKINGS ARE Â£4000. CUSTOMERS SPEND MORE MONEY IN SUNNY WEATHER THAN ON DULL, COLD DAYS. . SALES OF BREAD AVERAGE 500 LOAVES A WEEK. A LARGE WHITE LOAF COSTS 50p AND A LARGE BROWN IS 55p. HEALTH FOOD SALES ARE RISING STEADILY AND CIGARETTE SALES ARE ALSO ON THE INCREASE_ NEARLY 5000 A WEEK . ABOUT ONE QUARTER OF THE CUSTOMERS BUY PET FOODS. THE BUSIEST DAY OF THE WEEK IS FRIDAY, AND TUESDAY, WHICH IS MARKET DAY IN SALISBURY, IS THE QUIETEST.
